I was looking for a new client. That was when I saw her. She was talking to Mysterium sorcerers at an inn.

Seeing Sorcerers in Tria wasn't something new, but the sorcerers talking to a miserable looking woman was surely something you don't see everyday.

As the sun went down, the inn was full of laughter. However, I sat near the corner and quietly watched the woman. Maybe she saw me watching her. She came to me with a smile.

She said, "You know, you've been staring at me this whole time."

Putting down my beer I replied, "I meant no harm. I was just surprised to see you talking with those arrogant sorcerers."Next page.

She asked, "Why would that be surprising?

I laughed and said, "Well, your clothes are filthy."

"Those sorcerers, they're so obsessed of appearance that the first spell they learn is to clean their clothes."

She glanced at her clothes and said, "You have a point. They're so dirty, I'm practically wearing a patch of mud." She laughed and ordered a beer before continuing.

"I have no interest in cleaning spells. I just dress like this so no one annoys me."Next page.

"But you were enjoying your time with them, weren't you?" I had to ask.

She leaned down and whispered in my ear. "Because I know a resurrection spell."

I almost dropped my glass after hearing what she said. Could this woman be Oshar? THE Oshar?
I nearly screamed out of joy. This could be my new client. However, I managed to hide my feelings, and acted nonchalant.

"There's no such thing. Why would you lie about that?" I looked in her eyes. She was smiling.Next page.

"You're the first person to call me on my claim. I like that. Let's make a bet." She waved her hand in the air.

I said nothing, but watched her intenntly, to let her know I was interested. She slowly took out an old key out of her pocket and started swinging it back and forth. The key bore the symbol of shadmetal.

"They say...that the dead have no words. But..." She had a smile on her face.

I met her gaze. Suddenly, the candle on the table went out. Darkness fell, and a shaft of moonlight fell on her lips.

"Three in the morning. Heartwood. Don't forget."
